list.name: CommonSettings

binaryOption.name: Map all pins on startup
binaryOption.toolTip: Enables mapping of allocated pins during startup using mapAllPins()\n Multiply mapped pins cannot be assigned by mapAllPins()

choice.name: Don't map - Use manual mapping or enable mapping for peripherals individually
Map pins during startup using mapAllPins()

binaryOption.name: Lock mapped pins
binaryOption.toolTip: Lock pin control registers (PCRs) during mapAllPins()

choice.name: Don't force locked - Pins may still be individually locked
Force all pins to be locked in mapAllPins()

binaryOption.name: Disable unbonded pins
binaryOption.description: Lock out pins that are not bonded to physical pins on package
binaryOption.toolTip: In some smaller packages there are die pads that are not bonded to package pins\n For those pins the PCR can be set to 0 (analogue/disabled) to minimize power consumption\n This is the reset state

choice.name: Force unbonded pins to analogue function

binaryOption.name: Warn if multiple signals mapped to pin
binaryOption.description: Generate warnings about conflicting signal mappings
binaryOption.toolTip: It is allowable to have multiple signals mapped to a single pin on the understanding\n that they will be dynamically mapped during execution to avoid conflict.\n Multiply mapped pins cannot be assigned by mapAllPins()

binaryOption.name: Use extended type system for timers
binaryOption.description: Use a dimensioned type system for time and frequency
binaryOption.toolTip: Types 'Seconds', 'Hertz' and 'Ticks' are always defined but are simple aliases\n rather than a enforced type system using classes

intOption.name: Bitband size

binaryOption.name: Enable USBDM Bootloader
binaryOption.toolTip: This relocates the program image to allow space for a bootloader at the beginning of the flash region

intOption.name: Bootloader size
intOption.description: Amount of flash reserved for bootloader

stringOption.name: Linker memory map
stringOption.description: File used for target memory map

stringOption.name: Linker vector table
stringOption.description: File used for target vector table

category.name: Section placement in Flash
category.description: How regions are mapped to available Flash
category.toolTip:
Cortex-M4 Kinetis devices may have additional Flash that can be used as backing storage 
 for non-volatile memory (FlexRAM -> FlexNVM.)
 If not used for this purpose, FlexNVM may be used to hold code or constant data.
 These settings control which region (regular flash or FlexNVM) is used for various linker sections

choiceOption.name: Startup code
choiceOption.toolTip: Fixed placement for vector table and reset code

category.name: Section placement in RAM
category.description: How regions are mapped to available RAM
category.toolTip: The RAM on Cortex-M4 Kinetis devices is divided into upper and lower memory regions.\n These settings control which region is used for various linker sections.\n These sections cannot cross regions as unaligned half-word and long-word accesses are not supported

choiceOption.name: ramu_default
choiceOption.toolTip: This selects placement for the segment

choiceOption.name: raml_default
choiceOption.toolTip: This selects placement for the segment
